Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder section of a light-brown pottery jar, perhaps a Canaanite amphora, the fabric is grey in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of at least two lines of black-painted hieratic text with some similarity to the incense formulae of inscriptions relating to the resin trade.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393462) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393462)
